concept.title: Extending the DFST Container Set
concept.shortdesc: You can use the DFST containers and Composer script as a basis for creating your own containers tailored to your own needs

conbody.p: Docker containers use a layered architecture to build up the components of a container. This makes it easy to use an existing container as a base for creating new containers. All of the DFST containers are available from the Docker Hub.

Reasons to make your own containers include:
Pre-define the set of git repositories set up under GitLab
Pre-define some or all of the GitLab configuration: users and groups, authenticatoin policies, git hooks, etc.
Pre-define the GitLab continuous integration jobs
Set up your own Open Toolkit configuration with your custom plugins.
Control the network configuration details of the containers
Manage the containers in a private container repository
The DFST containers are defined and managed in GitHub in the DFST docker containers project.
